actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-21.
Measure called up as privileged matter in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #39 (336-73).

official_title: A resolution providing funds for the expenses of a welfare and pension plans task force under the jurisdiction of the Committee on Education and Labor.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-21) Authorizes funds, not to exceed $167,500, for the expenses of a special study and investigation of welfare and pension plans by the House Committee on Education and Labor. Makes such expenditures available to the Subcommittee on Labor-Management Relations. Prohibits such funds from being used in connection with the study or investigation of any subject being investigated for the same purposes by any other House committee. Terminates the authorization granted by this resolution on January 3, 1980.

titles.title: A resolution providing funds for the expenses of a welfare and pension plans task force under the jurisdiction of the Committee on Education and Labor.
